channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the capacity dimensions of the Brjuno and Perez-Marco sets
item.description: arXiv:2507.15980v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this work, we prove that the complement of the Brjuno set $\mathcal{B}$ has a zero capacity with respect to the kernel $k^1_\sigma(z,\xi)=\ln^2{|z-\xi|}\left|\ln{\ln{\left(e+\frac{1}{|z-\xi|}\right)}}\right|^\sigma$ for any $\sigma > 2$. Similarly, the complement of the Perez-Marco set $\mathcal{PM}$ has a zero capacity with respect to the kernel $k^2_\sigma(z,\xi) = \ln^{2}{\ln\left(e+\frac{1} {\left| {z - \xi }\right|}\right)} \cdot\ln^{\sigma}{\ln\ln\left(e^3+\frac{1} {\left| {z - \xi }\right|}\right)}$ for any $\sigma>2$.
item.dc:creator: Nurali Akramov, Abduvahhob Ashirov

item.title: Rigidity of proper holomorphic self-mappings of the hexablock
item.description: arXiv:2507.16176v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The hexablock \(\mathbb{H}\), introduced by Biswas-Pal-Tomar \cite{Hexablock}, is a Hartogs domain in \(\mathbb{C}^4\) fibered over the tetrablock \(\mathbb{E}\) in \(\mathbb{C}^3\), arising in the context of \(\mu\)-synthesis problems. In this paper, we prove that every proper holomorphic self-map of \(\mathbb{H}\) is necessarily an automorphism. Consequently, we resolve the conjecture \(G(\mathbb{H}) = \mathrm{Aut}(\mathbb{H})\) on the automorphism group structure, originally posed by Biswas-Pal-Tomar in \cite{Hexablock}.
item.dc:creator: Enchao Bi, Zeinab Shaaban, Guicong Su

item.title: Approximation of polynomial hulls by analytic varieties: A counterexample
item.description:
arXiv:2507.16338v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We construct a connected, compact set $K \subset \mathbb{C}^2$ with the following property: there exist points $p \in \hat{K} \setminus K$ such that there does not exist a sequence $\{A_
u\}$ of analytic sets $A_
u \subset\subset \mathbb{C}^2$ with boundary satisfying $p \in A_
u$ for every $
u \in \mathbb{N}$ and $\lim_{
u	o\infty} bA_
u \subset K$. For every point in $\hat{K} \setminus K$, we explicitly construct a sequence of Poletsky discs, and we compute the weak limit of the pushforwards of the Green current under these discs.
item.dc:creator: Tobias Harz

item.title: A note on the boundary dynamics of holomorphic iterated function systems
item.description: arXiv:2507.16358v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We consider the boundary dynamics of iterated function systems of holomorphic self-maps of the unit disc. Our main result provides a sufficient condition which guarantees that the dynamical behaviour of a left iterated function system in the interior of the unit disc can be extended to the boundary. This generalises an extension of the classical Denjoy--Wolff Theorem, due to Bourdon, Matache and Shapiro, to the setting of iterated function systems. To do so we modify estimates for the Hardy norm of composition operators and combine them with a new technique of perturbing a left iterated function system by elliptic M\"obius transformations.
item.dc:creator: Argyrios Christodoulou

item.title: Composition and Volterra type operators on large Bergman spaces with rapidly decreasing weights
item.description: arXiv:2507.16437v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We characterize boundedness, compactness and Schatten class properties of generalized Volterra-type integral operators acting between large Bergman spaces $A_\omega^p$ and $A_\omega^q$ for $0 <p, q\leq \infty$. To prove our characterizations, which involve Berezin-type integral transforms, we use the Littlewood-Paley formula of Constantin and Pel\'aez and corresponding embedding theorems. Our results generalize the work on integration operators of Pau and Pel\'{a}ez in J. Funct. Anal. 259 (2010), 2727--2756.
item.dc:creator: M. Almoka, H. Arroussi, J. Virtanen

item.title: Hypercomplex analytic spaces and schemes
item.description: arXiv:2507.16452v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We propose definitions of hypercomplex analytic spaces and hypercomplex schemes. We show that such a hypercomplex space is canonically associated to the quotient of a hypercomplex manifold by a finite group action.
item.dc:creator: Roger Bielawski

item.title: Generalizations of Some Inequalities of the Polar Derivatives of Polynomials
item.description: arXiv:2412.04176v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The main purpose of this paper is to present the generalization of the inequalities between the modulus of the polar derivative and the polynomial itself, depending on consideration of the zeros inside and outside of a closed disk and the extremal coefficient position of the underlying polynomial.
item.dc:creator: Deepak Kumar, Dinesh Tripathi, Sunil Hans

item.title: Positivity of tangent sheaves of projective varieties -- the structure of MRC fibrations
item.description: arXiv:2309.09489v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this paper, we extend the structure theorem for smooth projective varieties with nef tangent bundle to projective klt varieties whose tangent sheaf is either positively curved or almost nef. Specifically, we show that such a variety $X$, up to a finite quasi-\'etale cover, admits a rationally connected fibration $X \to A$ onto an abelian variety $A$. For the proof, we develop the theory of positivity of coherent sheaves on projective varieties. As applications, we establish some relations between the geometric properties and positivity of tangent sheaves.
item.dc:creator: Masataka Iwai, Shin-ichi Matsumura, Guolei Zhong
